result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Douglas S Baber in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 15CF989, 15CM918 and 15CM1038.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-15-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Douglas S Baber in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the Defendant's missed appointments with WCS.  Attorney Bricco advises the Court the reasons for the missed appointments.   The State requests additional cash bail.  Attorney Bricco requests bail remain as set.  The Court  reminds the Defendant the importance of complying with WCS and bail remains as set.  Attorney Bricco requests additional time to allow for a global offer and is waiting for a response from the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Douglas S Baber in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Bricco requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
